pullrequest.title: Fix Same File Error by change log likelihood filename.

content.raw:
Was hg rename used for the files or did you delete/add the other likelihood files? It's hard to see what bitbucket is showing here.

Setting instance_index to `None` as the default parameter seems incorrect (and potentially dangerous since it will be the default) here. Why not change only what destination filename will be, not the instance-level (source) filenames? It is not clear that this would change that. It's also confusing since everywhere else in the code instance_index is explicitly set to 0 for single instance runs. This may also cause potential downstream errors since there's no explicit check for the "None" case and there's no obvious guarantees from the code in this case that instance_index won't be used in a way that will cause errors later (e.g. assigned to a variable that is later used unexpectedly as a None value).

Regardless, is there a specific point in the code where the destination 'likelihood' filename is set where you can simply set it to a reasonable default?
content.html:
Was hg rename used for the files or did you delete/add the other likelihood files? It's hard to see what bitbucket is showing here.

Setting instance_index to None as the default parameter seems incorrect (and potentially dangerous since it will be the default) here. Why not change only what destination filename will be, not the instance-level (source) filenames? It is not clear that this would change that. It's also confusing since everywhere else in the code instance_index is explicitly set to 0 for single instance runs. This may also cause potential downstream errors since there's no explicit check for the "None" case and there's no obvious guarantees from the code in this case that instance_index won't be used in a way that will cause errors later (e.g. assigned to a variable that is later used unexpectedly as a None value).

Regardless, is there a specific point in the code where the destination 'likelihood' filename is set where you can simply set it to a reasonable default?

pullrequest.title: Fix Same File Error by change log likelihood filename.

content.raw:
I use hg mv which is the aliases of hg rename.

Set the default ```instance_index = None``` is the way how other method deal with this issue. 
Not everywhere in the code ```instance_index``` is explicitly set to 0. Instead, for all the file realted issue they are set to ```None```.
That's part of the reason why I set it this way because this give more consistency throughout the code.
```
#!python
    def set_params_filename(self, instance_index=None, new=False):
```
```
#!python=
    def save_input_master(self, instance_index=None, new=False):
```

Besides there are no other individual function responsible for changing final likelihood filename alone. 
```set_log_likelihood_filenames``` is designed to change both ```log_likelihood_filename``` and ```log_likelihood_tab_filename``` at once
content.html:
I use hg mv which is the aliases of hg rename.

Set the default instance_index = None is the way how other method deal with this issue. Not everywhere in the code instance_index is explicitly set to 0. Instead, for all the file realted issue they are set to None. That's part of the reason why I set it this way because this give more consistency throughout the code.

    def set_params_filename(self, instance_index=None, new=False):

    def save_input_master(self, instance_index=None, new=False):

Besides there are no other individual function responsible for changing final likelihood filename alone. set_log_likelihood_filenames is designed to change both log_likelihood_filename and log_likelihood_tab_filename at once

pullrequest.title: Fix Same File Error by change log likelihood filename.

content.raw:
For single instance runs it is explicitly set to 0 if i recall correctly (which I'd imagine is a substantial number of use cases).

The point I was getting at is the destination filename that the copy happens to can be simply named to `likelihood.ll`, correct?

I believe the original discussion/fix proposed just having the "winning"/destination likelihood file to be named without an instance number attached to it.
content.html:
For single instance runs it is explicitly set to 0 if i recall correctly (which I'd imagine is a substantial number of use cases).

The point I was getting at is the destination filename that the copy happens to can be simply named to likelihood.ll, correct?

I believe the original discussion/fix proposed just having the "winning"/destination likelihood file to be named without an instance number attached to it.

pullrequest.title: Fix Same File Error by change log likelihood filename.

content.raw:
Yes, simply renamed is the key point to the issue and it will be correct. But that will brings more complexity into code, despite the fact that it seems logically "simpler". 

If we only change the file name, a new parameter might need to be added to this function. We will also lost it consistency with how ```set_params_filename``` and ```save_input_master``` is designed where they both use ```None``` to refer to main thread run. 

Also I believe that the way how method ```set_log_likelihood_filenames``` is designed to change both ```log_likelihood_filename``` and ```log_likelihood_tab_filename``` at once implies that those two file name should be "equivalent" in some sense. It seems more reasonable to change them at the same time.
content.html:
Yes, simply renamed is the key point to the issue and it will be correct. But that will brings more complexity into code, despite the fact that it seems logically "simpler".

If we only change the file name, a new parameter might need to be added to this function. We will also lost it consistency with how set_params_filename and save_input_master is designed where they both use None to refer to main thread run.

Also I believe that the way how method set_log_likelihood_filenames is designed to change both log_likelihood_filename and log_likelihood_tab_filename at once implies that those two file name should be "equivalent" in some sense. It seems more reasonable to change them at the same time.

content.raw:
My mistake for taking this long to get back to this. I thought I'd had already commented on the latest set of changes.

The NEWS items are placed under the upcoming release which is in our case 1.2.2, not 1.2.3. No new heading is required. Please move your update to 1.2.2. The NEWS item should also state what the change fixed (segway not working when the 0-index instance training run "wins"), and less so what changes were made to perform the fix.

pullrequest.title: Fix Same File Error by change log likelihood filename.

content.raw:
Could you change the line "fixed the file are the same error of segway when the 0-index instance training run wins" to "fixed a bug when the 0-index training instance wins and fails to copy the result." 

Also "Now it will store the likelihood of winning instance *elsewhere*" is a little misleading since it didn't change the directory location of the liklihood file. The likelihood file is in the same location, but simply does not have a index suffix attached to it. Something along the lines of "Segway will now store the resulting winning likelihood file without the instance index as a suffix." would be suggested.
content.html:
Could you change the line "fixed the file are the same error of segway when the 0-index instance training run wins" to "fixed a bug when the 0-index training instance wins and fails to copy the result."

Also "Now it will store the likelihood of winning instance elsewhere" is a little misleading since it didn't change the directory location of the liklihood file. The likelihood file is in the same location, but simply does not have a index suffix attached to it. Something along the lines of "Segway will now store the resulting winning likelihood file without the instance index as a suffix." would be suggested.
